subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: Crystal radio technique
author: Stefan Bion
full_text:
Hi all,

in case anyone is interested: with reference to my below mail of last
week, I've built a random bit generator now, and also added a feature to
EVPmaker to use it as a random source. Here's the article:

http://www.stefanbion.de/evpmaker/random-bit-generator/index_e.htm

A first EVP test session with this RBG seemed promising...

Stefan

-- 

> Hi all,

> I remember that someone had selled a "raudive diode" build into a
> microphone plug, which is very similar to a crystal radio. It
> shouldn't be difficult to solder a diode, 2 resistors and 2 capacitors
> into a plug and test it. The schematic is here:
> http://www.worlditc.org/c_04_s_bridge_10.htm

> BTW, can anyone recommend a (tested) schematic for a simple random bit
> generator that can be connected to the LPT port? It should be able to
> deliver about 10,000 random bits (TTL level) per second. I'd like to
> add an option for connecting an external 'hardware' random number
> generator to EVPmaker.

> Stefan

> P.S.: A new EVPmaker version is available for download on my website:
> http://www.stefanbion.de/evpmaker/
> It has some additions as for instance 2 new random sources (Internet
> and "manual sweep"), and a new "live audio source" mode.
